column2:
The Kannada Reading assessment detailed below was carried out by Akshara Foundation in 2011-2012 in a small set of schools to determine the reading proficiency among Government Primary School children. All the children have been assessed using a standardized baseline test and based on their reading ability they are divided into 5 levels:
Zero Level
where the child can barely identify 25% of the alphabet
Letter Level
where the child can identify most of the letters
Word Level
where the child can identify words
Sentence Level
where the child can read sentences
Paragraph Level
where the child can read the entire paragraph
Number of Government Primary Schools in Bangalore which this assessment has been carried out:
Number of Government Primary Schools in this Constituency which this assessment has been carried out:

Akshara Foundation's Anganwadi Assessment are an essential part of the Anganwadi Programme and detailed below are the results of a baseline assessment of the children of all Anganwadis in Bangalore in 2011-2012. 56 indicators have been devised to measure motor skills; cognitive skills; social and emotional skills; language skills among the children and normalised median score across all the children for this constiuency has been indicated in this analysis.
